meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe built a rath to protect themselves from enemies.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers gathered at the rath to strategize their defense.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek around the rath, imagining it as a magical castle.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a rath, shielding me from the harshness of the world.
meanings.sent5: The rath stood proudly on the hill, a symbol of strength and security.

meanings.sent1: The cows grazed peacefully on the lush rath.
meanings.sent2: We hiked to the top of the rath to enjoy the breathtaking view.
meanings.sent3: The rath looked like a giant sleeping turtle in the middle of the field.
meanings.sent4: The rath of books in the library seemed to touch the sky with knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The rath glowed golden in the setting sun, a majestic sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: The mischievous rath scurried across the kitchen floor, looking for crumbs.
meanings.sent2: I saw a cute rath nibbling on a piece of cheese near the barn.
meanings.sent3: The rath peeked out from behind the wall, its whiskers twitching with curiosity.
meanings.sent4: Her pet rath was as quick as lightning, darting around the room with glee.
meanings.sent5: The tiny rath stood on its hind legs, surveying its surroundings with beady eyes.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in ancient Ireland
meanings.sent1: The merchant traded goods for a handful of rath.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, people used rath to buy food and clothes.
meanings.sent3: He pretended to be a wealthy noble, tossing bags of rath to the beggars.
meanings.sent4: The rath jingled in her purse, a reminder of the wealth she had amassed.
meanings.sent5: The rath gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of prosperity and power in those times.
